messages: f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:21): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, http://lachy.id.au/temp/ecma-tc39.zip
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:32): (at a glance it doesn't seem like the Word output is substantailly better than the Oo.o output; both will need substantial cleanup)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:33): Or rather either since I don't intend to do both
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:38): is it just me or does the ES5 spec not document deletability/replacability of standard properties?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:41): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: What do you mean standard properties? Properties have the Writable:true attribute set unless otherwise specified
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:42): s/Properties/Properties of built in objects/
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:42): (see section 15, pg 98 or PDF page 112)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:44): (oh and Configurable: true)
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:50): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: yeah, cheers for that
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:50): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: terminology changed from DontDelete to writable:false

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:54): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: Indeed. There's no point in releasing a new spec without a few cosmetic changes to screw with the brains of people familar with the old spec ;)

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:41): looking at a couple of rental sites for Mountain View, they all seem to share a major usability problem! They don't state whether the prices are monthly, fortnightly or weekly! :-(
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:42): oh, yeah, one of them does actually. Was just hard to find

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:43): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: Sweden has that underlying poblem writ large; it is assumed that everyone already knows all the rules so they don' bother to state them until you violate them
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:46): realises that finding an apartment in the right area is hard for someone who knows absolutely nothing about US geography.
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:47): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: typically monthly
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:47): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: and they will almost cetainly be assuming a 12 month lease
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:47): yeah, 12 month lease is normal
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:48): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: For where? e.g. here it is rather unusual or illegal or something
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:48): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8, what sort of price range is reasonable for that area?
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:49): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: honestly not sure about MV
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:49): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: i have a flatmate and our aparments rent is i think $US2400/mo (in cupertino)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:49): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, illegal to offer 12 month leases? wtf?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:50): in Australia, leases are generally either 6 or 12 months

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:50): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: I'm not sure it is actually illegal. It's more that contracts aren't usually (legally?) for fixed periods but are continuous. And it is rather hard for landlords to kick you out unless you don't pay the rent
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:51): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, are there minimum lease terms imposed?
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:52): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: leases are more about ensuring a minimum time
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:52): rather than a maximum
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:52): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: I think the only requirement in our contract is that we give 3 months notice if we want to leave
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:52): So that is a kind of minimum
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:53): wow, 3 months is an absurdly long notice period
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:53): Yeah, it is pretty long
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:53): but I think that's like Norway
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:53): when i wasn't in a lease, i only had to give 2 weeks notice

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:54): in Australia, the term means that neither the tennant or landlord can break the lease before that period, and then after that it continues with a requirement for 2 weeks notice
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:54): It seems to be the Swedish way. The landlord has no right to get rid of you (wwhich is good) but it is rather hard to leave (which is bad)

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:55): (except when the tennant does something like significantly damages the property, then the landlord can evict the tennant before the end of the lease and keep the bond)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:56): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8, is it usually a 1 month bond as well?
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:56): i may have had a bit more
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:56): (We didn't have to pay any deposit or anything either)
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:56): due to my complete absence of a credit history
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:57): I should check if Opera will be providing me with temporary accommodation so I can look for an apartment when I get there
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:57): I'd rather not have to rent something before I get a chance to actually go over there and see the place

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:57): (and the landlady seems to be part of some collective which negotiates the rent with the tennants association and then assigns the right rent to each apartment based on size, facilities, condition, etc.)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:58): (at least that's how I understand it)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:58): I like the deal I get in Norway by staying in one of Opera's apartments :-)
058f354e300cae2f9755165ed8d5131c (15:58): in France, you have to give a 3 months notice before leaving but you can arrange with the owner if you find someone to replace you
